business.headline: China asks chipmakers to use at least 50% local equipment: ReportLarge public investments are supporting this push. Through the government-backed "Big Fund", China has poured hundreds of billions of yuan into the sector, including a major new funding phase launched in 2024.

Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower as FII outflows weigh on investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 20.46 points to close at 84,675.08, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by just 3.25 points to end at 25,938.85.

Home buying with purpose: Simple steps to turn property into wealthAcross metro cities and several tier-2 cities, residential prices have moved up steadily over the last decade. Land prices have increased, construction costs are higher, and most new housing supply is coming in the mid to premium segments.

These Indian billionaires added the most wealth in 2025According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, Mukesh Ambani was the biggest wealth gainer among Indian billionaires in 2025. Ambani added $16.50 billion to his net worth during the year.

New Year 2026: 5 easy personal finance tips for better money controlWith rising costs and busy lives, managing money can feel overwhelming. As 2026 begins, these easy personal finance tips can help you stay organised and confident about your money.

Last date for revised ITR is tomorrow, December 31: Will the deadline be extended?There is only one day left to file a revised ITR for the current assessment year. With growing pressure on taxpayers and professionals, many are now wondering whether the Income Tax Department will extend the revised ITR deadline.

BNW unveils Tonino Lamborghini Residences in Ras Al KhaimahBNW Developments introduced the first Tonino Lamborghini Residences in Ras Al Khaimah with a launch attended by celebrities and industry stakeholders.

Only 1 day left for PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline: Are you legally exempt?With December 31 just a day away, taxpayers are running out of time to link PAN with Aadhaar. For most people, the process is mandatory, but some individuals are legally exempt from this requirement.

IndiGo hikes pilot allowances after rostering chaos, flight cancellationsThe revised allowances will come into effect from January 1 and apply across multiple categories, including domestic layover, night operations, deadhead travel and a newly introduced tail-swap allowance.

Explained: Silver's record rally and the China connectionDespite a recent dip, silver is still up more than 150% for the year. Silver prices recently climbed to around $82.5 an ounce, or roughly Rs 254,000 per kg, marking a lifetime high.

Why gold, silver and copper left stocks behind in 2025In a year defined by uncertainty, metals quietly did the heavy lifting, reminding investors that when confidence fades and supply tightens, tangible assets often speak louder than forecasts.
Sensex opens 130 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Tata Steel down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 113.64 points to 84,581.90, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 29.60 points to 25,912.50 as of 9:36 am.

Silver prices today: Why are rates falling and what should investors knowSilver fell 8.7% in a single day, marking its biggest one-day fall since August 2020. This sharp drop cleared some excess heat from a rally that had turned very steep in recent weeks.

Gold, silver rates: Are prices rising or falling today?Gold and silver have seen a very strong rally this year. The sharp rise in silver prices has been driven by supply limits, low stock levels, and strong demand from both industry and investors, while gold has seen a surge due to safe haven demand.

Protests erupt in Iran as currency hits record low, central bank chief quitsIran's largest protests in three years erupted after the rial plunged to a record low, driving up prices, forcing the central bank chief's resignation and intensifying anger over inflation and economic mismanagement.

Indian banking sector shows stability, bad loans fall to multi-decade low: ReportIndia's banking sector has shown resilience in 2025, with strong growth, improved asset quality, and attention to emerging climate risks, according to a recent Reserve Bank of India report.

India's crude oil imports rise in December as Delhi continues buying from MoscowIndia's Russian oil imports are poised to top 1 million barrels per day in December, defying expectations for a sharp decline as refiners have resumed buying from non-sanctioned entities offering deep discounts.

China to cut import tariffs on key commodities and medical supplies in 2026: ReportChina has announced cutting duties on key resource-based materials, including recycled black powder used in lithium-ion batteries.

The uncomfortable truth behind silver's spectacular rallySilver's rise is increasingly being driven not by sentiment or speculation, but by a deep and persistent shortage of physical metal. And that shortage is now reshaping how the market works.

8th Pay Commission: Check key expectations on salary hike, DA, and arrearsWith the 8th Pay Commission set to kick in from January 1, 2026, central government employees and pensioners are keen to know how much their salaries may rise, what could change in Dearness Allowance, and when arrears might be paid.

entertainment.headline: Rashmika Mandanna celebrates 9 years in cinema with a heartfelt note: Full of joy Rashmika Mandanna celebrated nine years in cinema with an emotional note thanking her fans for their constant love and support.

Malcolm in the Middle revival trailer reunites Frankie Muniz, Bryan Cranston Hulu and Disney+ announce the revival of Malcolm in the Middle, unveiling a trailer and confirming the original cast's return for a special four-part event set to premiere in April.
Teja Sajja not exiting Jai Hanuman, team shuts down baseless rumours Speculation around Teja Sajja's upcoming projects has been put to rest after an official clarification from his team.

Ryan Coogler recalls scrapped Black Panther 2 story about T'Challa and his son Director Ryan Coogler revealed that the original 'Black Panther' (2018) sequel would have centred on T'Challa, his son, and the ancient "Ritual of 8," with an in-progress attack by Namor. Coogler admitted he loved that initial script deeply.

Tara Sutaria calls out alleged paid negative PR campaign against her and AP Dhillon Tara Sutaria has accused unnamed parties of running a paid negative PR campaign against her and AP Dhillon. The incident highlights growing concerns over organised online harassment and influencer accountability.

Kantara Chapter 1 records strong search volume on Google India in 2025 Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chapter 1 made a strong impact in 2025, with Indian audiences searching for the film in large numbers, as shown by Google India's Year Ender list.

Anil Sharma, Fatima Sana, celebs get emotional after watching Dharmendra in Ikkis The makers of Dharmendra's last film 'Ikkis' hosted a star-studded screening to honour the veteran actor's legacy. After the show, several celebrities praised the film and celebrated Dharmendra's remarkable body of work.

BTS celebrates V's birthday with rooftop madness and gym sessions The members of BTS marked V's 30th birthday with a series of livestreams from HYBE's rooftop and gym, delighting fans worldwide as they reunited following their military service.

BB19's Malti Chahar clears air on Amaal Mallik dating rumours: No relationship ever Bigg Boss 19 fame Malti Chahar has clarified that she never dated singer Amaal Mallik and that they met only once before the show.

GV Prakash reunites with actor Ajith for documentary on motor sports journey Composer GV Prakash Kumar will collaborate again with Ajith Kumar by scoring the music for a documentary that explores Ajith's passion for motor sports and racing achievements. The project is directed by Vijay.

Basil Joseph goes Gen Z as Samkutty in Athiradi, film set for Onam 2026 release The makers of Athiradi have unveiled Basil Joseph's character poster, confirming an Onam 2026 theatrical release and sparking buzz over the actor's youthful new look.

Agastya Nanda to Suhana Khan, Sai Pallavi: Bollywood debuts to watch in 2026 From Agastya Nanda to Suhana Khan, 2026 is shaping up to be a crucial year as a fresh lineup of debutants steps into the spotlight, ready to test their mettle and embrace the pressures and promise of stardom.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan a remake of Bhagavanth Kesari? Director of 2023 film reacts Director Anil Ravipudi of the 2023 release, Bhagavanth Kesari, has addressed the rumours that Thalapathy Vijay's upcoming Jana Nayakan is a remake of his film.

Arshad Warsi says he was tricked into supporting role in Priyadarshan's Hulchul Arshad Warsi called the film 'Hulchul' (2004) a "bad experience," recalling how he was allegedly tricked into a supporting role. The actor was promised a character equal to Akshay Kumar in 'Hera Pheri' (2000).

Mohanlal's mother Santhakumari dies at 90 in Kochi after prolonged illness Santhakumari, mother of actor Mohanlal, died on Tuesday following age-related ailments. She had been undergoing treatment at her residence in Elamakkara, Kochi.

Exclusive: Mohit Chauhan's new song Meri Aawaaz speaks for stray dogs Singer Mohit Chauhan has created a song titled Meri Aawaaz for stray dogs that are often ignored, displaced, or treated as a problem by society.

Parasakthi vs Jana Nayagan: Producer Aakash calls clash unnecessary controversy Amid discussions over the release dates of Parasakthi and Jana Nayagan during Pongal, producer Aakash Baskaran emphasised that the situation is a normal occurrence for the festival period and urged audiences to view it as a healthy practice.

Siddhu Jonnalagadda announces new film, moves on from Kohinoor and Badass After months of speculation around stalled projects like Kohinoor and Badass, Siddhu Jonnalagadda has officially announced a new film.

Karan Johar asks to stop celebrating failures as Tu Meri Main Tera struggles Filmmaker Karan Johar shared a note on social media, calling for renewed empathy and less negativity amid the box office failure of Tu Meri Main Tera Tu Meri.

general news.headline: Jaishankar to attend Khaleda Zia's funeral in Dhaka tomorrow amid strained tiesThe act is seen as New Delhi's outreach to Dhaka at a time when India's relationship with its South Asian ally has plunged, ever since Sheikh Hasina was ousted in a student uprising last year.

Hindu worker shot by colleague in Bangladesh factory, 3rd such killing in 2 weeksA Hindu garment factory security guard was killed inside a factory in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district after a colleague allegedly fired a government-issued shotgun during duty hours.

India slams China's criticism of Salman's Battle of Galwan, cites creative freedomThe government said that storytellers are free to choose narratives they believe are important, and cinematic expression should not be politicised.

Know more on cutting necks: Naga minister's warning over Chicken's Neck threatNagaland minister Temjen Imna Along's warning comes at a time when radical elements in Bangladesh have raked up politics over India's strategically crucial Chicken's Neck, which connects the country to the Northeast.

Khaleda Zia: India-born 'Putul' whose anti-India politics strained ties with DelhiKhaleda Zia: Bangladesh's ties with India have been shaped largely by two leaders - Sheikh Hasina and Khaleda Zia. While Hasina anchored Dhaka firmly to New Delhi, Zia's tenure saw a pivot towards Pakistan and China. Little known, however, is that Zia was born in India.

Shilpa Shetty's Goa club operates despite grave violations even after Birch fireIndia Today TV has learnt that Shilpa Shetty's Bastian is running illegally amid Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) violations in Goa. Despite an earlier demolition order, the Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority (GCZMA) has granted further time. Not many other club owners have been so fortunate since the Birch fire incident.

Mullahs must leave: Massive protests break out in Iran. Is there a Trump angle?Iran is witnessing its largest unrest in three years. Chants of "mullahs must leave" and "death to the dictator" have echoed across major Iranian cities as protesters clashed with security forces of the Ayatollah Ali Khamenei-led theocratic regime. The eruption of anger and turmoil has been fuelled by a collapsing rial, record inflation and years of sanctions, amid renewed American pressure under US President Donald Trump.

CBSE reschedules Class 10, 12 board exams set for March 3. Check revised datesThe CBSE Class 10 and Class 12 exams earlier set for March 3, 2026, have been rescheduled due to administrative reasons, while all other exam dates remain unchanged.

Who is Aviva Baig, Raihan Vadra's fiancée-to-beRaihan Vadra and Aviva Baig, both accomplished creative professionals, are set to formalise their long-term relationship with an engagement ceremony in Rajasthan. The couple share a deep bond through art and photography, marking a new chapter in their lives.

UP man starved to death, daughter a bag of bones: Servants' greed fuels horrorRetired railway employee Om Prakash Singh Rathore, 70, died of starvation and neglect, while his mentally-challenged daughter, Rashmi was found in a skeletal condition.

If terrorists are in Bengal, did you carry out Pahalgam? Mamata counters Amit ShahMamata Banerjee, addressing a rally in Bengal, labelled Amit Shah and Prime Minister Narendra Modi as Dushyasahan and Duryodhana as she launched a vitriolic attack over the SIR exercise and allegations of infiltration.

Sunny Leone's New Year event in Mathura cancelled after religious groups objectActor Sunny Leone's New Year 2026 event, planned at a restaurant in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, was cancelled after strong objections from seers and religious organisations, who said such a programme was inappropriate for the holy city of Braj Bhumi.

Naagin 7 review: Priyanka Chahar in a slithering storm of nonsenseRelease Date:Sat Dec 27, 2025Naagin 7 review: Seven seasons in, Ekta Kapoor's franchise returns with louder CGI, regressive beauty politics, and AI-heavy story that reduces mythology and empowerment to caricature-ish drama.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

Video: 2 groups throw stones at each other at Gujarat village; 42 detainedAuthorities in Kalana village in Ahmedabad district responded to a tense situation after a dispute between two groups escalated into stone-throwing, leading to multiple detentions.

Ellyse Perry withdraws from WPL 2026 in big blow for Royal Challengers BengaluruEllyse Perry has withdrawn from the Women's Premier League 2026 due to personal reasons, with Sayali Satghare named as her replacement. USA pacer Tara Norris and Australian all-rounder Annabel Sutherland have also pulled out of the tournament.

How a 150-gram Amur falcon bird flew 6,000 km from India in 6 daysThe birds are known to breed in China or Russia and then begin their migration in October until December. The migratory period sees them fly long distances, starting from parts of Northeast India and Bangladesh.

Live: Khaleda Zia's funeral on Wednesday, to be buried with full state honoursBangladesh Violence News Live Updates: Bangladesh is witnessing deepening turmoil ahead of the February elections, triggered by Khaleda Zia's death, sustained street protests, and widening political divisions. Diplomatic strain with India, a major party's election boycott, rising law and order concerns, and increased international scrutiny are adding to uncertainty as the interim government pushes ahead with polls. Stay with Indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

CBSE suspends affiliation of GD Goenka school in Gurugram for 2026–27The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has suspended the affiliation of G D Goenka High School in Gurugram for the 2026–27 academic session after finding serious lapses in safety and infrastructure norms.

The Pant Paradox: Why India's Test maverick is failing the white-ball testThere is a murmur that Rishabh Pant may be dropped from the ODI side for the New Zealand series in January. Once touted as an all-format star, he now finds himself pushed to a corner. The problem, though, may not be limitation, but excess.

The Last Queen: Kota Rani and the Twilight of Hindu KashmirThe Buddhist prince from Ladakh, the refugee who had murdered his own benefactor, Ramachandra, and seized the throne, was gone. He left behind a widow who was also the daughter of the man he had killed, and a son, Haider, who was barely old enough to understand what a throne meant. The power vacuum was immediate and absolute.

Why the Japanese hairwashing method is the internet's new haircare obsessionA slow, scalp-focused hair washing technique from Japan is going viral for the promise of healthier hair. The method is less about products and more about how you wash your hair.

Caught on CCTV: Panic, then horror as BEST bus crushed pedestrians in MumbaiFour people, including three women, died and nine were injured after a reversing bus of Mumbai's civic-run transport undertaking knocked down pedestrians on Monday night.

Pet air travel is becoming more inclusive, but is it enough?More paws are ready to board, and more tails are waiting for purr-fect landings. With just a little more support, vacations could feel just as purr-fect for pets too.

sports.headline: 5th Women's T20I Live: India aim 5-0 sweep to end 2025 on a high India Women vs Sri Lanka Women Live Score: India are looking for a whitewash in the first T20I at the Greenfield Stadium in Trivandrum. Sri Lanka, on the other hand, are looking to restore some pride.

Suryakumar Yadav used to message me a lot: Actress makes explosive claim Actress Khushi Mukherjee has gone viral on social media after making a bombshell claim involving the India T20I captain. Mukherjee has claimed that Suryakumar Yadav used to message her frequently in the past. However, she has denied any romantic involvement with a cricketer.

T20 World Cup 2026: Oman name Jatinder Singh as captain, leave out veteran Kaleem Oman's most experienced player, Jatinder Singh, will captain the national team at the 2026 ICC Men's T20 World Cup after missing the previous edition. The squad features five changes from the Asia Cup, with veteran Aamir Kaleem omitted despite recent strong performances.

Australia, England are disregarding Ashes, disrespecting Test cricket: Chappell Ashes: Legendary Greg Chappell has lashed out at the Australia and England teams after the Boxing Day Test match failed to last two days. In a scathing column, Chappell has written that both teams are disrespecting the legacy of Test cricket.

Ellyse Perry withdraws from WPL 2026 in big blow for Royal Challengers Bengaluru Ellyse Perry has withdrawn from the Women's Premier League 2026 due to personal reasons, with Sayali Satghare named as her replacement. USA pacer Tara Norris and Australian all-rounder Annabel Sutherland have also pulled out of the tournament.

Shaheen Shah Afridi returns home from BBL with knee injury ahead of T20 World Cup Pakistan's Shaheen Shah Afridi will return home from the Big Bash League after suffering a knee cartilage injury while fielding for Brisbane Heat.

ICC agrees with Gautam Gambhir's assessment, spares Kolkata pitch a poor rating The ICC rated the Eden Gardens pitch as 'satisfactory' despite criticism following India's Test defeat to South Africa. The decision contrasted with the Melbourne Cricket Ground receiving an 'unsatisfactory' rating, underlining differing pitch standards in international cricket.

Indian Olympic Association to host first athlete-led forum in Ahmedabad on Jan 10 The Indian Olympic Association will convene its inaugural National Athletes' Forum on 10 January in Ahmedabad. The event aims to give athletes a direct role in shaping sports governance, with a focus on athlete rights, welfare, and policy reform.

Sensational Amelia Kerr warms up for WPL 2026 with maiden T20 century Mumbai Indians' Amelia Kerr warmed up for WPL 2026 in emphatic fashion, smashing her maiden T20 century to lead Wellington to a 49-run win against Auckland and underline her all-round value ahead of the season.

Ashes: England players cleared as investigation into excessive drinking row ends According to a report from the Daily Mail, the England players have been given a clean chit as the investigation into the excessive drinking row has come to an end.

Pakistan hockey players threaten FIH Pro League boycott as pay dispute continues Senior Pakistan hockey players have threatened to boycott the upcoming fixtures in Australia, citing significant discrepancies in daily allowances paid for the recent Argentina leg of the FIH Pro League. The dispute centers on a gap between the amount promised and the amount received, with federation and board officials citing conflicting policies and funding restrictions.

Barcelona president Joan Laporta accused of fraud, summoned to court: ReportFC Barcelona president Joan Laporta has been ordered to appear in court after being accused of fraud, according to a report by Spanish daily AS, placing renewed legal scrutiny on the club's senior leadership.

Smriti Mandhana sets sights on T20 World Cup, WPL after record-breaking 2025Smriti Mandhana is gearing up for a packed T20 roadmap toward 2026, regaining form against Sri Lanka while eyeing the WPL and T20 World Cup after a record-breaking year when she completed 10,000 runs in international cricket.

Ashes: Australian batting coach held accountable for Steve Smith's side's MCG failureFormer Australia opener Matthew Hayden has slammed the national team's batting coach following the heavy Ashes defeat at the MCG, questioning both coaching accountability and the technical preparedness of Australia's top-order batters as scrutiny intensifies ahead of upcoming Tests.

Shafali Verma, Renuka Singh gain big in ICC T20I rankings after Trivandrum heroicsShafali Verma and Renuka Singh have made significant jumps in the ICC Women's rankings after performing brilliantly in the Trivandrum leg of the T20I series against Sri Lanka. Shafali is the leading run-scorer of the series while Renuka took a four-wicket haul in the third T20I.

Brevis shows no game management: Proteas legend slams star's SA20 failuresHerschelle Gibbs questioned Dewald Brevis' game awareness after another SA20 failure. With the T20 World Cup 2026 approaching fast, the young batter's form is becoming a growing concern for South Africa.

Rohit, Kohli's Test retirements felt unnatural: Ex-batter's explosive claimRobin Uthappa questioned the timing of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's Test retirements. The former India batter feels the exits did not appear natural and believes the full truth may emerge later.

Abhishek Sharma was India's best in 2025: Ashwin urges ODI debut for batterRavichandran Ashwin believes Abhishek Sharma has been India's best performer of 2025. The former spinner also backed the explosive opener for an ODI debut after his game-changing impact in T20Is.

Australia still best team in women's cricket: Gardner ahead of India seriesStar all-rounder Ashleigh Gardner believes Australia remain the "best team in the world" despite no longer holding the T20 or ODI World Cup titles, and is confident the side will respond strongly when they renew their rivalry with India in February.

After MCG heroics, Josh Tongue named in England provisional squad for T20 World CupJosh Tongue has been included in England's T20I sqaud for the Sri Lanka tour and the provisional squad for the T20 World Cup. Tongue took a five-wicket haul in Melbourne as England recently beat Australia in an away Test for the first time since 2011.

Watch: Captain Suryakumar visits Tirupati with wife before T20 World CupIndia's T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav visited Tirupati temple seeking blessings ahead of the T20 World Cup. His recent batting struggles add pressure as he prepares for crucial upcoming series.

Pakistan Cricket Board parts ways with Test head coach Azhar Mahmood: ReportPakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has parted ways with the national Test team head coach Azhar Mahmood three months before the expiry of his contract, according to sources.

Don Bradman's Baggy Green from historic home series against India up for auctionA rare Baggy Green cap worn by Sir Donald Bradman during the 1947/48 home Test series against India, and later gifted to S.W. Sohoni, will be auctioned publicly for the first time, with strong international interest expected due to its provenance and historical significance.

India's Test report card for 2025: Spark abroad, scars at home, chaos withinThe doyens retired after a forgettable tour of Australia. A young leader then took charge and showed promise in England. However, a crushing home defeat against South Africa cast a long shadow over the Indian Test team's 2025 report card.

Shubman Gill naysayers warned: World Cup snub not the end of his road in T20IsT20 World Cup 2026: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has warned against writing Shubman Gill off in T20Is, saying the star batter has the tools to make a successful return to the side. Gill was left out of India's T20 World Cup side.

Robert Lewandowski exposes Barcelona's tactics to dodge bonus payments to BayernRobert Lewandowski has revealed a surprising request from Barcelona during last season's La Liga run-in. The striker said financial concerns led the club to ask him to avoid scoring and triggering a bonus payment.

Coach Sourav Ganguly under early pressure as Pretoria Capitals lose 2 in 2SA20 2025-26: Sourav Ganguly's Pretoria Capitals have lost their first two matches in the new season. On Monday, they were comfortably outclassed by 48 runs by SunRisers Eastern Cape.

Hardik Pandya to make Test comeback? Robin Uthappa picks all-rounder as ideal no. 7Robin Uthappa believes Hardik Pandya's Test chapter may not be over yet. The former India batter feels Pandya could return as India's No. 7, provided fitness and workload are carefully managed.

Watch: Gukesh blunders under pressure, loses blitz game to 12-year-old prodigyWorld champion Gukesh Dommaraju suffered a shock blitz defeat in Doha. A late blunder under time pressure allowed 12-year-old prodigy Sergey Sklokin to claim one of the biggest upsets of the World Blitz Championship.

The Pant Paradox: Why India's Test maverick is failing the white-ball testThere is a murmur that Rishabh Pant may be dropped from the ODI side for the New Zealand series in January. Once touted as an all-format star, he now finds himself pushed to a corner. The problem, though, may not be limitation, but excess.

Smriti Mandhana set to overtake Shubman Gill for run-scoring record of 2025Smriti Mandhana is closing in on the biggest batting record of 2025. The India opener needs just 62 more runs to overtake Shubman Gill and become the leading run-scorer across men's and women's international cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
